description: The cause of CVE-2023-5473 is a use-after-free vulnerability in the casting mechanism of the Chromium framework, which underpins Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based). This flaw allows for improper access to freed memory, leading to potential memory corruption and exploitation. It affects the Microsoft Edge versions including build number 118.0.2088.46 and it is crucial for users to apply updates as recommended to prevent exploitation of this vulnerability. The patch is documented in the Microsoft Knowledge Base article indicating that the latest version is no longer affected by this issue.
